m_szDocTitle: Study Shows No Long-Term Climate Benefit From Shale Gas Revolution
m_szDocSumamry: textArticle -------------------- Study Shows No Long-Term Climate Benefit From Shale Gas Revolution Originally published on Think Progress By Joe Romm More abundant, cheaper shale gas (dark blue) has little impact on annual growth in U.S. CO2 emissions through 2050 compared to low shale gas case (light blue). This is true for multiple energy-economy models. Deep cuts in CO2 require a rising carbon price (green).
